reviews.title: Work great
reviews.text:
The factory feet on my mouse were leaving dark spots on my light colored desk at work.
These fit great and have noticeably lower friction than the worn factory pads. The adhesive is strong but repositionable if you don't get it right first time.
When the old pads are removed, they can split into separate layers, but you should be able to get down to the bare plastic if you take care to grab the lowest layer of clear adhesive.

reviews.title: Great battery life
reviews.text: I'm still not fully decided about how I feel about this mouse. But, I can talk about what I know so far. The packaging I got the mouse and was really nice, really simple, but easy to open. The mouse was easy to set up, and the RGB looks pretty cool. There is a really cool DPI changer function that makes gaming much easier, however, I can't recommend this mouse for gaming because the ergonomics are pretty trash. I have to cramp my hand like a claw over the top of the mouse and after long periods of use it does start hurting. The surface is also pretty slippery, so I found that my hand slips on the mouse all the time. The tracking however, is great! And I would have to say that biggest plus is the battery life. I got this about 2 weeks ago, charged it once, and it is yet to die! I think the features of this mouse are great, but I would not recommend it. Purely because of the ergonomics, if you are going to use this mouse often, then you probably should go if something more ergonomic.

reviews.title: Poor performance | no charge indicator
reviews.text: Highly susceptible to interference. Drags and lags.

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.text: I like the size and the LED colors.  The battery life is a little lackluster and it actually starts acting up when it's "tired".  I got it for my iPad but haven't used it a month or so b/c I got tired of her attitude.

reviews.title: Had 2 of these and they both died
reviews.text: Will never buy from this company again... the second one we bought froze and would not work again.. same as the first one.

reviews.title: Basic but functions well
reviews.text: I ordered a ‘LED Wireless Mouse, Uiosmuph G12 Slim Rechargeable Wireless Silent Mouse, 2.4G Portable USB Optical Wireless Computer Mice with USB Receiver and Type C Adapter (Silver)’ for review.  For the price point, this is a basic mouse.  The rotating light strip is a cool looking feature.  It is sleek in design.  It connected well with the dongle to my Surface Pro.  It glides well over a mouse pad.  It is rechargeable, which I prefer to battery operated.  The click of this mouse is quiet. The dongle slides into the bottom and of course it has already been lost.  I prefer the dongle to be stored in a closed compartment on a mouse.  It does not require recharging for several days of moderate use and seems to charge quickly.  Overall, for basic use, this mouse works well.

reviews.title: Computer mouse

title: SHARKOON Drakonia Gaming Mouse - Black
description: The Drakonia Black is the follow-up model to our popular Green Drakonia. Like before, the Drakonia Black has eleven buttons and a 4-way scroll wheel, with each being freely programmable through the included configuration software to perform various different functions. An ADNS-9800 laser sensor from Avago operates under the gray dragon scales casing, with the current DPI setting in use indicated by a constantly illuminating LED. The SoftSkin surface of the Drakonia Black offers a soft grip and prevents perspiration build-up, ensuring the mouse fits perfectly in the hand even during heated battles. Likewise, the ergonomic shape of the Drakonia Black is designed for stability and control: its outwardly curved underside offers more grip during very small and precise movements as well as a high-level of comfort during long gaming sessions. Therefore the Drakonia Black is aimed especially at FPS Snipers and RTS/RPG gamers - the type of players who typically launch themselves into long battles and epic adventures. In the underside of the Drakonia Black you will find six metal weights comprising the Weight Tuning System, allowing the fighting weight of the mouse to be adjusted at any time. Unleash your inner Dragon – with the Drakonia Black!
features: Programmable Buttons: 11
gold-plated usb connector
Chip: Avago ADNS-9800
Max. DPI/CPI: 8,200
Cable Length: 180 cm

title: Logitech M585 Multi-Device Wireless Mouse – Control and Move Text/Images/Files Between 2 Windows and Apple Mac Computers and Laptops with Bluetooth or USB, 2 Year Battery Life, Graphite
description: Talk about a game changer! With Logitech FLOW, M585 Multi-Device has the almost magical capacity to navigate seamlessly on two computers and copy-paste from one to the other – even if you're using a PC and a Mac. It certainly beats sending yourself emails. M585 also comes with a host of other features to improve your productivity, your way: fast and easy scrolling through long web pages; five programmable buttons, including two handy thumb buttons; a 2-year battery life** and a curved, domed shape that supports your palm comfortably during long hours of work or play. Dual connectivity (Bluetooth or 2.4 GHz Logitech Unifying). DUAL CONNECTIVITY - Use with up to three Windows or Mac computers and laptops via included Unifying receiver or Bluetooth Smart wireless technology
LONG BATTERY LIFE- The Logitech M585 just keeps going, with 2 years of power on a single AA battery
ULTRA-PRECISE SCROLLING- Micro-precision wheel packs more grooves per millimeter to make scrolling through long webpages faster and easier
CURVED DESIGN - Domed shape provides right hand support for your palm comfortably during long hours of work or play

reviews.title: Excellent travel size and 6 month long battery life!
reviews.text:
Updated 1 year later(May 3, 2020)

Down grading from 5 stars to 3 stars because it turns out there might be a bug in the mouse that once you pair it with 2 different computers over bluetooth, you cannot reset the mouse to use the wireless dongle. There is also no support on the Logitech website - try searching their website for the manual for this mouse, it's absolutely missing. You'll see an FAQ section and some various sections on tech spec, but no setup guide or manual!

*********

If you're tried of replacing batteries, this mouse is for you! I'm impressed by how long a single AA battery lasts in this mouse. I haven't had to replace the battery since getting it 6 months ago even with daily use. The two modes is nice since it lets me connect this mouse to two computers! The bluetooth is strong and connects well to my MacBook Pro, while the included radio frequency receiver is plugged into a iMac and I can switch between computers with a. simple button click.

reviews.title: Great travel mouse!
reviews.text: Love the feel of it. Easy to connect. Small enough to use for travel yet big enough to where it doesn’t hurt to use ergonomically.

reviews.title: WOW! Seamless movement from one computer to the other!
reviews.text:
This device synched to both computers quickly. Download the 'Logi Options' software on both, then enable 'Flow'
Move the mouse off the bottom of one screen & it appears at the top of the other laptop.
Copy a file on computer one, switch to the computer two, right-click->paste. You have copied the file took computer one to computer two.
The mouse itself is legit comfortable, precise asks smooth.
Add 'Flow' and it is also revolutionary.
Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Nice mouse for Mac Pro using Big Sur OS
reviews.text: I was looking for a mouse for my MacPro computer.  It's got 2 buttons on the mouse that I wanted to setup as volume up, and volume down.  But there is no instructions on how to do this, and I can't find any.  I'm using the mouse as a standard mouse with scroll for web pages.  Works perfect for that.

reviews.title: Nice and quiet
reviews.text:
Nice, quiet mouse at a great price. It's on the smaller size, just what I needed for carrying in the computer bag. I have long fingers, but not necessarily large hands, and this fits perfectly for me. The scroll wheel is nice and smooth (and also quiet). You can feel some tactile "knurling" when you scroll, so it's not baby's-butt-smooth, but it's not like scrolling over a circular-saw blade either.

Using the USB dongle, the mouse is very responsive. The Bluetooth connection seemed a little laggy to me. No stars off unless it does the same when I test it on another PC.

I do not intend to install the Logitech Options software so I cannot speak to the usefulness of Flow or reassigning buttons.

Pros
- USB and Bluetooth connectivity
- Can use with up to two devices.
- 7 buttons: L, R, Center, Center-Left, Center-Right, Back, Forward. Eight if you include the PC selector button.
- Very quiet left/right click buttons
- Nearly quiet center click and back/forward buttons
- Uses one AA battery (preferred over non-replaceable battery)
- Battery life advertised at 2 years.
- Has an on/off switch on the bottom

Cons
- Possible laggy response using Bluetooth. I need to test on another PC to be sure.

Other consideration:
- The USB dongle storage is behind the battery door. If you frequently remove the dongle from the PC, this might be a concern for you (it's not a problem for me).

reviews.title: Super product. Great price.
reviews.text: Really responsive and not overly sensitive. Has been a great addition for tablet. Seamless connection didn’t loose once. Easy to navigate instructions for set up. Great battery life. Used for 7 hours consecutive without sign of needing charged.

reviews.title: Move along. Don't waste your time and money here.
reviews.text:
UPDATE: Two months! Two months this mouse lasted, and that was with very light use. Fully charged, I was just scrolling with it when I felt the wheel break. It just stopped making the little clicky sound/feeling. No trauma, no misuse, just very very very cheaply made. I surrender. It's time to cough up the money and buy the Apple brand mouse for my MacBook. My sanity is at least worth the $60.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
After three previous tries, I finally got a Bluetooth mouse for my MacBook. I'm hoping this one is sturdier than the last I purchased that barely lasted six months. That remains to be seen, but given the product materials, I'm not hopeful. Making the connection after power-up or sleep mode is a little finicky. Also, a solid flat dark surface/mouse pad seems to be a prerequisite. Without it, the cursor is slow to respond or just does its own thing. I've never seen a mouse with the jitters before, but this one will cause the cursor to jiggle and twitch, even though the mouse itself it perfectly still, untouched. I've watched the cursor jitter clear off the screen. However, using a solid black mouse pad seems to have dealt with the problem. I would send it back and try a different product, but I've sent so many cheaply made and/or mislabeled mice back to Amazon in the past month, I've got return fatigue. We'll give this one a chance with the mousepad solution.

reviews.title: Won't hold a charge - must keep plugged in
reviews.text:
I've been through two of these. I returned/exchanged this first hoping it was just a defect. This mouse will only function appropriately for about 4-5 minutes tops if not directly plugged in to USB , otherwise it starts jumping/skipping/lagging etc. Plugged in it's perfect though - so if you get lucky and get one that holds a charge you'll probably be very happy with it. I just decided to keep this one and keep it plugged in. It's not ideal but it gets the job done.
I should probably mention that it is very easy to set up, basically plug and play - which was nice.

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.text: Great size and portability.  Saves a slot for other use.

reviews.title: Worth it!
reviews.text: This purchase is worth it. The mouse is slim and connects perfectly with the laptop. Careful you don't lose the mouse in your papers!

reviews.title: Responsiveness is abysmal
reviews.text:
I have a Fellowes mouse pad (vinyl material) and this mouse moves the pointer on it like it is stuck in mud - very slow. Yes, i removed the coated ovals on the bottom. I tried on my desktop protective cover (a softer plastic) and it was even worse. Putting the mouse on paper made it move the mouse pointer faster and smoother but occasionally had hiccups. This is unacceptable for gaming, let alone basic office work. This wasn't even the worse part of this mouse.

The mouse buttons require you to click on the very edge of the button to recognize the click. Because my finger tips reach about 75% of the length I would have to click 3+ times to get Windows 11 to recognize I clicked the button. I made sure to charge the battery to 100% and tried numerous USB ports on my computer and on my docking station to no avail. Would not recommend.

reviews.title: Helped my forearm pain and works as described
reviews.text: Works as described, more natural wrist position and seems to be helping my forearm pain

reviews.title: Very nice mouse!
reviews.text:
I've seen a few of these mice around and this one was inexpensive enough to give the design a try. I normally use only Bluetooth mice because I don't like losing a USB port to a dongle, but made an exception.

I have to say I'm impressed with this device. The performance is rock-solid and it feels great to use. I also like the slightly rubberized finish; feels good in the hand. What I'm doing is alternating between this and a conventional mouse every few days to give my wrist a break. The reduction in wrist discomfort is noticeable.

It's worth losing a USB port to a dongle

reviews.title: Ergonomics
reviews.text: The concept of this mouse is that your hand is in a more natural position when you use it. That part works fine. There is a hesitation that occurs from time to time that will cause you some angst. The mouse button has to wake it from sleep mode, which also takes some getting used to. Overall it is a decent mouse and surprisingly easy to adapt to.

reviews.text: I purchased this for my Dell laptop, and it stops working after a couple of minutes.  I have to turn the mouse power switch off and on again before the mouse will work again, then a couple of minutes later it stops again.  Pretty worthless.

reviews.title: works well

reviews.title: good

features: Brand New in box. The product ships with all relevant accessories

reviews.title: Laptop is not like new it is new the box had never been opened, Thank You So Much
reviews.text: I'm so happy with this purchase the items are exactly as described

reviews.title: Sucks, Slow, Terrible, Missing pieces.
reviews.text:
Extremely slow unless you know how to disable 50 or so features that run off the bat. The mouse came with no bluetooth adapter, and this doesn't have built in bluetooth.
Seriously don't buy HP.

1 hour of ownership update: It's stopped opening windows. It brings up the login screen, then I get a black screen. The computer no longer works and I've done nothing to it. There are several other reviews referring to this issue.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: so far its a great buy. I like it

reviews.title: Excelent value laptop
reviews.text: My daughter needed a faster more copact laptop for her graphics software so we gave this one a try.  Very fast, easy setup...nice and easy to chuck the bloatware.  A reasonable price made it an easy choice...so much so that we purchased another.

reviews.title: Definitely returning and buying a different brand
reviews.text: I had high hopes for this laptop... very very very slow. I mean how can a company like HP in this day in age make a laptop this slow. I didn’t expect speeds you would see in a gaming laptop for this price but I at least want to be able to watch a movie or even start the laptop within 10 minutes, and they don’t even allow you to upgrade the RAM or anything from what I can tell... and the battery life is laughable, like a previous comment said, about 1 percent per minute. I would even go as far as to say that it dies faster than that. Purchased this for my sister for her birthday but will definitely return and go with a different laptop.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo, EDJO Full-Sized Ergonomic Computer Keyboard with Wrist Rest and 3 Level DPI Adjustable Wireless Mouse for Windows, Mac OS Desktop/Laptop/PC (White)
features: 【ERGONOMIC WIRELESS KEYBOARD AND MOUSE COMBO】EDJO Full-sized wireless keyboard is ergonomically designed with Palm Rest and folding holder that can keep it at an optimum slope，prevent your wrists from hurting while long sessions of typing. Keyboard is also designed with anti-slide pads so it will stay in place when you're typing quickly. NOTE: THE USB RECEIVER IS INSERTED IN THE BATTERY COMPARTMENT OF THE MOUSE, YOU CAN FIND IT WHEN OPEN THE MOUSE BATTERY COVER.

【PLUG & PLAY 2.4G WIRELESS CONNECTION】One 2.4 GHz USB receiver can connect both the keyboard and mouse, can also be used separately, plug & play, no need to download any software. 2.4 GHz wireless provides a powerful and reliable connection up to 33 feet(10m) without any delays.

【AUTOMATIC POWER SAVING FUNCTION】The EDJO wireless keyboard and mouse combo has the function of automatically entering the power-saving state. When you stop using the keyboard more than 30 minutes, stop using the mouse more than 25 seconds, they will enter sleep mode respectively to save power. This feature greatly extends the battery life, you can click any button to activity the device. The keyboard need 1 x AA battery, the mouse need 1 x AA battery. (Battery Not Included)

【WIRELESS OPTICAL MOUSE】The mouse was optical design, even on some smooth surfaces, precise control can be obtained. 3-level adjustable DPI (800/1200/1600) allows you to choose your favorite moving speed of cursor. In addition, this wireless mouse is symmetry design, no matter you are Right handed Left handed, both hands are available, suitable for all people.

【UNIVERSAL COMPATIBILITY & AFTER-SALES SERVICE】This wireless keyboard and mice combo compatible with windows XP/Vista/7/8/10/X, Mac and other operating system. Works well with desktops, Chrome-book, PC, Laptop, Computer and more. If you encounter any problems during use, please contact us via Amazon email, we will provide a satisfactory solution.

reviews.title: works as expected
reviews.text: works perfect; smaller than my last one so much better for traveling

reviews.title: The mouse and keyboard work on the same USB plug.
reviews.text: The mouse and keyboard work on the same USB plug. I like the fact that this pair frees up one of your USB ports on your CPU. Thank you. God bless you. May the rest of your life be the best of your life.  OZ

reviews.title: Usable keyboard. Mouse is a little problematic.
reviews.text: The keyboard is good and more ergonomic than others but lack of function keys makes less than desirable. The mouse just kept, intermittently disconnecting so was unusable.

reviews.title: Comfortable to use
reviews.text: I didn't have any expectations for this wireless keyboard and mouse set. I just wanted it to sync up easily to the PC and it did. More than that, it is a surprisingly comfortable keyboard to work with. The keys are responsive and accurate. I can put it at an angle that I like. It is easy to store away. I just really like it more than I had expected. I may not have had particular expectations. I just wanted to try out a keyboard/mouse set on a PC that wasn't getting much use, but I may end up putting this set with my main PC set up. I like it that much.

reviews.title: Plug n Play
reviews.text: This is a nice keyboard mouse combo. Set up was simple. There is one dongle for both the keyboard and the mouse. The keyboard is quiet, comfortable and a good size. The mouse is responsive. Time will tell how long it lasts but for now I am pleased with its performance.

RECHARGEABLE MOUSE WITH LONG BATTERY LIFE -- This Mouse has a built-in rechargeable battery which means you can use it without running the risk of not have a couple of batteries at hand. Comes with USB and Type C cables for charging

reviews.title: Cheap and useless.
reviews.text: This mouse feels so cheap, it wasn’t even worth giving a review but I wanted to warn others to not get this mouse. It’s so flimsy and made so cheaply, I didn’t waste anymore time with it so I am returning.

reviews.title: Flawless Bluetooth connectivity with Mac
reviews.text: My Logitech M310 (been using them for 10-15 years) could not connect properly with my USB-C/Thunderbolt MacBookPro, using their USB dongle, thru a USB adapter. Scroll wheel would NOT work, and Logitech tech support said they would not update drivers. 'Don't use an adapter.' But they aren't aware that new Macs don't have old-school USB ports? Anyone else have this problem?! Anyway... this Seenda connects directly with Bluetooth, and connects instantly. If it sleeps (after a few hours?) it wakes and re-connects with one click, in less than a second. I charged the battery when I bought it a few weeks ago, and forgot that I might need to charge it again one day. Still going. Downsides: it is much smaller and lighter than I am used to (the M310 is easily twice as thick/tall) so I am getting used to that. Took awhile to find the right DPI/resolution/speed (and the button to change that is in a precarious, easy-to-hit-by-mistake position. Overall a great recommend.

reviews.title: squeaks when scrolling - not for small hands
reviews.text: Loud clicks, SQUEAKS when scrolling, made for larger hands. You would think since it's pink it wouldn't be designed for a mans hands but here we are. Ultimately, the obnoxious squeaking while scrolling is why I am returning it.

reviews.title: Works great but... The wheel squeaks!
reviews.text: This mouse works great but the wheel squeaks!

reviews.text: It's good okay.

reviews.title: Hey it works great HIGHLY RECOMMEND
reviews.text:
It works does random motion immediately recognized by my dell laptop workstation
I’m not monitored by my boss so can’t give insight to that consideration. IT KEEPS MY SCREEN open so I don’t have to keep logging in
Wish the jiggle button had a light to tell it’s active HOWEVER perhaps this is a good thing (it immediately jiggles so I know it’s working) no light no one knows around me it’s on
I’d highly recommend this

reviews.title: Great Wireless Mouse and Jiggler
reviews.text: This mouse is the perfect size and weight, moves well and clicks quietly. I love the jigglier functionality; you just press the button built into the mouse and it keep the mouse cursor moving on the screen. It keeps my window open and Office teams active. I should have gotten a mouse like this long ago; it allows you additional freedom at work when you need to be away from your desk for a while. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Very good idea
reviews.text: Very good idea to have this jiggler built in, other similar products need to have an additional equipment, and put mouse on it for moving, not as convenient as this one. But sometimes this product is not stable, after a couple of hours working, I found the mouse stopped moving, I checked and found the battery light was off due to unknown reason, and after I reset the battery, the mouse moved again, and such kinds of issue happened several times. Therefore, I can only gave 4 stars review. But anyway I like this cute tool.

reviews.title: Keep screensavers from activating or keep from being logged off for no activity!
reviews.text:
A very handy, take it with you mouse that will keep pretty much anything from timing out due to lack of activity. When you need to step away for a few minutes and not have anything you are working on, just press the button on top to activate the jiggler and keep the mouse pointer gently moving.
I have only had this for a week or so and it has already proved it's worth. When my screen saver kicks off any process I have running slows way down. When I am rendering media this is a major pain, or I should say "used to be a major pain".
The dongle for USB connectivity stores in the mouse itself so you can carry the mouse and never have to worry about losing the dongle. It also has an on/off switch to save battery life.
A nice piece of gear, I suggest this for anyone that doesn't want to time out again.

reviews.title: Quiet and Functional
reviews.text:
I have been searching for a product like this for a long time! I work remotely most days and have to rely on connecting through a VPN connection. The connection automatically disconnects after a certain time frame, so this jiggler function is great! I can click the button to activate and leave the computer.
The setup on this mouse is so simple. I plugged in the USB and the mouse worked right away.
My favorite feature that was unexpected was how quiet the mouse is. I wasn’t use to not being able to hear a click. Such a nice product!

reviews.title: Very Nice
reviews.text:
Very nice. Looks good, I like the gold edging more than I thought I would. A little small, but I barely notice. The mouse I WAS using was HUGE, and my entire palm rested on it. This one only covers ⅔ of my palm.

Very comfortable.

Have not played anything that could be considered a stress test. I like that you can turn it off, but I dislike that you have to remember to turn it off.

I cannot tell if it goes to sleep.

reviews.title: wireless mouse
reviews.text: My old wireless finally died - dropped too many times onto the hardwood floor.  I purchased one that was like the old one and this one.  This one is flatter.  I ended up choosing to use this one.  It loaded quickly and is very comfortable to use.  Very, very quiet click - almost silent.  Having said all of this, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

reviews.title: Good value for the price
reviews.text: This is a good value for the cost.  If you need something small and easy to carry around with you this is great. Especially right now I am between working from home but sometimes have to visit the office and the less and smaller items I carry, the better!  This is nice and slim and works great with my laptop.  I don't really like to use batteries but as long as you switch it off when not in use you will be able to get quite a bit of use out of one.

reviews.title: Loses Connection CONSTANTLY
reviews.text: I have to turn it off and on about 5x a day because it randomly loses connectivity. When I am using it or idle for less than 1 min.

reviews.title: Good So Far
reviews.text: Easy to install.  Nice color. Has on off switch with usb inside by battery.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: I was looking for something a bit angled because my wrist was feeling uncomfortable but I didn't want an extreme twist to the side. I've always used Logitech mice but this has been working great. I wish it had a couple more buttons on it so I could set a button to heal and one to my 4th skill but otherwise it's just what I needed. It goes to sleep when you don't use it and wakes up when you click so I don't have to turn it off. And it's blurple, the best color.

reviews.title: Not the best

The scrolling feature only works randomly, most of the time when you click, you have to click twice for it to work. Used brand new batteries but it didn't make a difference. Disappointed that I wasted money, will stick with a name brand.

reviews.title: Cool looking but not the best mouse
reviews.text:
I wanted a cool looking mouse to replace a Microsoft mouse that was starting to act funny, after 5 + years. After using it for an hour now I really wish I would have spent more for functionality rather than aesthetic value.

First of all I had to pull out a sheet of paper to use as a mouse pad because my old Microsoft mouse functioned with any surface that I used it on, performed flawlessly. This new mouse can't even be used on a standard wooden desk without skipping and jumping all over the screen.

I prepared myself mentally for a cheap feeling mouse because in the end you get what you pay for but holy cow this mouse feels like something I would buy at the local dollar store it screams lack of quality.

I am sure I will be buying another mouse to replace this one shortly either from frustration or because it was built at such a low quality standard.

reviews.title: Mouse for computer
reviews.text: My grandson loved it and he couldn't believe how fast it got here.

reviews.title: Mouse
reviews.text: I really like the Logitech Wireless Mouse M305. It was simple to hook up and I like the size. I like the fact it has a turn off switch underneath so I can extend the battery life. I use it with my desktop.

reviews.title: My favorite mouse
reviews.text: My favorite mouse. I have several of these, with different themes. They are reliable and just the right size for my adult female hands. Most adult mice are at least a little clumsy and over-sized, while chidren's mice are too small. Also this model comes in awesome designs, although this model has been STUPIDLY discontinued.

reviews.title: Great price for this two pack

reviews.title: Value of the product
reviews.text: It was nice to get two 24" monitors for the price of one. It greatly helps by increasing the amount of screen I have to work with and the picture quality is phenomenal.

reviews.title: great monitor for the price
reviews.text: A great value and more importantly an excellent monitor.  I like the narrow edge border as it provides more space than my previous monitor without sacrificing screen space.  I like the clarity, no dead pixels, and less blue light issues.  very satisfied.

reviews.title: Easy to view and use.
reviews.text: I'm enjoying my first extended screen and found it quite intuitive. The colors are bright and the 24" size is great for a smaller setup. The screen can tip up and down but it does not rotate. No problem for me.

reviews.title: I couldn’t be happier perfect picture!
reviews.text: Great color and clarity!!!!

title: Rii Wireless Mouse RM700 2.4G Silent Mouse with 3200 DPI,Computer Mouse with USB Nano Receiver for Laptop,PC,Mac,Chromebook,Windows and School Work(Orange)
features: Slient BUTTON: This wireless mouse with Noiseless Click, you can force on your work or study, also suitable for cafe, library or any other public place. It won’t disturb other people while using. Also it’s portable enough to take out and travel.

HIGH DPI DESIGN: This wireless mouse was built for three DPI levels(1600-2400-3200) to meet your demands. The factory default is 2400, you can kindly press the DPI button to change it. It’s only take 2 AAA battery (NOT INCLUDED) to power. This wireless mouse will turn to sleep mode in 5mins of inactivity for energy saving, can be easily activated by clicking any buttons.

PLUG AND PLAY: The USB Nano Receiver is in the battery slot, 2.4GHz Wireless provides a good connection, transmission distance up to 33ft (10m). Which eliminated delays, interference, accurate fast data transmission . There is a on/off button which enables you to turn off the mouse for energy saving. Great wireless mouse for home and office.

MAXIMUM HAND-FEELING: Slim wireless mouse shape reduces skin-friendly finish are for maximum comfort and support. The thoughtful ring and little finger rest provide extra comfort. The sturdy scroll wheel with rubber makes sure that your hand will not slip when scrolling.
WIDE COMPATILITY: This wireless mouse can be compatible with Laptop, Desktop , Notebook PC, Windows XP, Windows 8/9/10, Windows Vista, Mac OS , Chromebook.

reviews.title: mouse
reviews.text: good product would buy again

reviews.text: I've had this about a yea, works great.
